answers.text: combined force of allied German states was organised by the British to protect Hanover

qas.question: How did the British support Prussia?
Why did the Dutch reject Britain's offer to join the alliance?

answers.text: the Dutch wished to remain fully neutral

qas.question: Who had done better, the Prussians in Europe or the Brits in North America?

answers.text: successful for the Prussian-led forces on the continent, in contrast to disappointing British campaigns in North America.

qas.question: Who led the force to defend Hanover?

answers.text: under the command of the Duke of Cumberland

context: Britain had been surprised by the sudden Prussian offensive but now began <a1_0>shipping supplies and ₤670,000<a1_0/> (equivalent to ₤89.9 million in 2015) to its new ally. A <a0_0>combined force of allied German states was organised by the British to protect Hanover<a0_0/> from French invasion, <a4_0>under the command of the Duke of Cumberland<a4_0/>. The British attempted to persuade the Dutch Republic to join the alliance, but the request was rejected, as <a2_0>the Dutch wished to remain fully neutral<a2_0/>. Despite the huge disparity in numbers, the year had been <a3_0>successful for the Prussian-led forces on the continent, in contrast to disappointing British campaigns in North America.
